00059     template< typename Ty, class Comp=std::less<Ty> >
00060     class EnumeratedDomain :public BasicEnumerated {
00061     private:
00063       typedef std::set<Ty, Comp> container_type;
00064       
00065     public:
00067       typedef typename container_type::const_iterator iterator;
00068       
00075       explicit EnumeratedDomain(TREX::utils::Symbol const &type)
00076       :BasicEnumerated(type) {}
00091       template<class Iter>
00092       EnumeratedDomain(TREX::utils::Symbol const &type,
00093                        Iter from, Iter to)
00094       :BasicEnumerated(type), m_elements(from, to) {
00095         if( m_elements.empty() )
00096           throw EmptyDomain(*this, "Newly created EnumeratedDomain is empty.");
00097       }
00098       
00106       explicit EnumeratedDomain(TREX::utils::Symbol const &type,
00107                                 Ty const &val)
00108       :BasicEnumerated(type) {
00109         add(val);
00110       }
00111       
00113       virtual ~EnumeratedDomain() {}
00114       
00115       // Extra helpers
00131       void add(Ty const &val) {
00132         m_elements.insert(val);
00133       }
00154       template<class Iter>
00155       void add(Iter from, Iter to) {
00156         m_elements.insert(from, to);
00157       }
00158       
00164       bool contains(Ty const &val) const {
00165         return isFull() || end()!=m_elements.find(val);
00166       }
00167       bool intersect(DomainBase const &other) const;
00168       bool equals(DomainBase const &other) const;
00169       DomainBase &restrictWith(DomainBase const &other);
00170       
00171       size_t getSize() const {
00172         return m_elements.size();
00173       }
00174       
00175       boost::any getElement(size_t i) const {
00176         typename container_type::const_iterator it = begin();
00177         // std::set doe not provide operator[]
00178         // I need to do the iteration by my own
00179         for(; i>0 && end()!=it; ++it, --i);
00180         // if it==end() the behavior is undefined
00181         // but that also means that i>=getSize()
00182         return *it;
00183       }
00191       iterator begin() const {
00192         return m_elements.begin();
00193       }
00201       iterator end() const {
00202         return m_elements.end();
00203       }
00204       
00205     protected:
00212       EnumeratedDomain(EnumeratedDomain const &other)
00213       :BasicEnumerated(other), m_elements(other.m_elements) {}
00235       EnumeratedDomain(rapidxml::xml_node<> const &node) 
00236       :BasicEnumerated(node) {
00237         completeParsing(node);
00238       }
00239       
00240       void addTextValue(std::string const &val) {
00241         add(TREX::utils::string_cast<Ty>(val));
00242       }
00243       std::ostream &print_value(std::ostream &out, size_t i) const {
00244         // Not very optimal but this is the easiest way to go
00245         return out<<(getTypedElement<Ty, false>(i));
00246       }
00247       
00248     private:
00258       container_type m_elements;
00259

00265     
00266     template<class Ty, class Cmp>
00267     bool EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp>::intersect(DomainBase const &other) const {
00268       if( getTypeName()!=other.getTypeName() ) 
00269         return false;
00270       else {
00271         EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp> const &ref 
00272         = dynamic_cast<EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp> const &>(other);
00273         if( isFull() || ref.isFull() )
00274           return true;
00275         else {
00276           iterator i = begin(), j = ref.begin();
00277           iterator const endi = end();
00278           iterator const endj = ref.end();
00279           
00280           while( endi!=i && endj!=j ) {
00281             if( m_elements.key_comp()(*i, *j) )
00282               ++i;
00283             else if( m_elements.key_comp()(*j, *i) )
00284               ++j;
00285             else 
00286               // *i and *j are equals -> intersection is not empty
00287               return true;
00288           }
00289           // no similar items -> itersection is empty
00290           return false;
00291         }
00292       }
00293     }
00294     
00295     template<class Ty, class Cmp>
00296     bool EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp>::equals(DomainBase const &other) const {
00297       if( getTypeName()!=other.getTypeName() ) 
00298         return false;
00299       else {
00300         EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp> const &ref 
00301         = dynamic_cast<EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp> const &>(other);
00302         return m_elements==ref.m_elements;
00303       }
00304     }
00305     
00306     template<class Ty, class Cmp>
00307     DomainBase &EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp>::restrictWith(DomainBase const &other) {
00308       if( getTypeName()!=other.getTypeName() ) 
00309         throw EmptyDomain(*this, "Incompatible types");
00310       else {
00311         EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp> const &ref 
00312         = dynamic_cast<EnumeratedDomain<Ty, Cmp> const &>(other);    
00313         container_type tmp;
00314         std::set_intersection(begin(), end(), ref.begin(), ref.end(), 
00315                               std::inserter(tmp, tmp.begin()), 
00316                               m_elements.key_comp());
00317         if( tmp.empty() ) 
00318           throw EmptyDomain(*this, "intersection is empty.");
00319         m_elements.swap(tmp);
00320       }
00321       return *this;
00322     }
